website_summaries.verdict: Fast, cheap, and compact, the HP LaserJet Pro P1606dn offers a winning combination of value and performance for home offices or small businesses in need of a monochrome laser printer.
pros: The compact HP LaserJet Pro P1606dn is easy to set up, and offers rapid printing at an affordable price
cons: No cables are included, and some banding is evident in grayscale graphics

customer_reviews.title: Used, fair price, works OK so far......
customer_reviews.text: Shipping was fast, the HP P1606dn printer arrive well packed surrounded by foam cushions on all 6 sides. Came without a toner cartridge. The Ad did say no toner was included so can't complain. I had a spare aftermarket toner ready to go and popped one in. Held down the paper feed button for 5 sec and out popped 2 nicely printed pages. Print count was 8200 pages, not bad. We wanted this P1606dn printer because it is great at printing Avery labels and doesn’t jam like Brother printers do on labels.
customer_reviews.author: M.M.

customer_reviews.title: The speed and quality are excellent. My Linux OS
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer six years ago. It has never jammed nor failed to print. The speed and quality are excellent. My Linux OS, Kubuntu, recognized it automatically when I plugged it into a USB socket and the duplex plugin was automatically installed. Later I attached it to my wifi router and configured it for a static IP so that all my digital devices could access it. I've owned several printers since My first PC, an Apple ][+ purchased in the summer of 1978, and this printer is far and away the best. It is equal in speed and reliability to printers I used at work that cost thousands of dollars.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry L. Kreps

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: Much better quality than some other recent modestly-priced HP Laserjets, some of which have been major disappointments. Decent printing speed, high quality printing AND network capable. Easy installation as networked printer on both Mac and Windows machines on our combined office network. Good office backup printer if you do not need duplex or multiple paper drawers. This is a backup for our HP Laserjet Enterprise m604dnwith two paper drawers . Easily switchable to USB shared or completely local Mac of Windows machines. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Robert G.Williamson

customer_reviews.title: Best printer i've ever owned! PERIOD!
customer_reviews.text: this is the best printer i've ever owned! my brother does alot of advertisement and usually likes to print in black and white. we would usually print 15 thousand flyers a week with this printer times 52 weeks in a year. YES YOU ARE READING THIS CORRECTLY! THATS ROUGHLY 780,000 flyers a year and i've had this printer for over 4 years and its still running strong! it takes after market cartridges from amazon extremely well without clogging the printer heads! worth every penny! little to no paper jams, prints extremely fast, and you can get about 2,000 sheets A CARTRIDGE; even with after market cartridges. NEED I SAY MORE!?
customer_reviews.author: Matt B.

customer_reviews.title: Superb Printer
customer_reviews.text: This is a great printer. It is fast and produces perfect text.Like most laser printers, it is not the best at producing photos, but that's what ink-jets are for. The printer is small and easily situated. Also, it is much less noisy than some people have indicted. The automatic setup did not work for me with Windows 8, but using the Installation CD was perfect. Fast and painless. The networking function worked instantly and perfectly. Some have complained about the small cartridge. Replacement cartridges from other manufacturers (including refills) are available for about $15 (sometimes 2 for fifteen) so this isn't as much of a problem as one might think. I highly recommend this printer for individuals and small businesses.
customer_reviews.author: Philip Ross Gordon

customer_reviews.title: good printouts, light and easy to carry, flimsy trays
customer_reviews.text: I've had this printer for about a month and used it quite a bit. like this printer and it does just what it should. It makes decent black and white copies quickly and most important to me the paper feed works well. I've had problems with inexpensive printers in the past, always with the paper feed. So far so good. I dinged it one star for the flimsy brittle plastic extension that holds the printouts and keeps them from falling on the floor. Also it would have been nice if it closed up completely. The paper tray folds but doesn't hook into the main box. Makes it easier than it should be to damage when moved.
customer_reviews.author: Jean Yates

customer_reviews.title: Totally Painless Mac Network Install
customer_reviews.text: This is a quick review of installing the printer on my home network, then printing from a Mac Pro with a wired connection running 10.8.5, a MacBook Pro with a WiFi connection running 10.8.5, and an iPhone 5 running iOS 7.02. Here's how you do it: 1. Plug in power cord 2. Plug in ethernet cable 3. Print That's it: no reading the manual, no driver download, no reboot, no nothing. Duplex printing worked, AirPrint on the iPhone worked, zero effort, zero problems. Oh, I forgot: 4. Load paper. I don't see how it can get any easier than this. The hardest part by far was unpacking the printer while eating a sandwich. Don't do that: you need both hands.
customer_reviews.author: John R. Corso

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again!
customer_reviews.text: Still going strong after 2 1/2 years. (I only go through about 2 cartridges per year though). Printer is sturdy and the tray and paper catcher extension have as yet to break, although I've bumped them a lot and they've also suffered as cat platforms. Had one issue early on where I couldn't power it back up after a power outage....I called HP customer service and they had me push on the power button really hard several times. It sounded silly, but worked! No problems since. March 2017 update: I only go through 2 toner cartridges a year, but this printer is still running like a champion. There's never a paper jam and it works consistently well.
customer_reviews.author: Desert Denizen

customer_reviews.title: A great general purpose duplex laser printer
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this printer after years of owning jet print printers. I wanted something that didn't have me purchasing supplies all the time. While the verdict is still out concerning laser vs jet options I will say I am very impressed with the over all quality of print and speed of this printer. The setup was very easy and my concern of the printer being utilized by my various devices was quickly overcome. This printer just plain works! It works well on both my Mac Air, Windows based computers along with my IPad and Apple phones. If your looking for a great monochrome workhorse printer with fast duplex printing this is the one.
customer_reviews.author: OhioFM

customer_reviews.title: Read and be amazed.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this one for my dad because I already bought one for myself. That should say something. Here are some stats of the printing and a simple explanation of why you should get a laser jet printer: Black Cartridge Order HP Part CE278A 20%* Approximate Pages Remaining*: 450 Supply Level: Normal Serial Number: 566363944 Pages printed with this supply*: 1890 First Install Date: 20121208 Last Used Date: 20150216 That's not even one cartridge of toner. It was generic toner too. Still works.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Ivy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Performance After Two Months of Constant Use
customer_reviews.text: I needed a laser jet printer that would print two-sided and this one seemed to fit my needs. I purchased it on August 30, 2014 and installed it on September 4, 2014, and after two months of constant use I can officially say that it has performed outstandingly. I really like how it automatically shuts off when not in use and how it is easily re-awakened. It does everything I ask of it. I would definitely recommend this printer to anyone wanting a reliable and relatively inexpensive LaserJet printer.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick McHugh

customer_reviews.title: A really fast, low cost laser printer
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up. First page of a print order from Word or WordPerfect takes a good 7 seconds. Then the pages come out quickly. I don't know if it's 26 pages per minute -- I didn't time it. But, compared to an ink jet, it's almost magic, with extremely high quality print. Cost wise, if the toner works as advertised, it prints text pages about five cents each, which is much less than an ink jet printer per page. Colored pages are rendered in sharp gray scale. I retired a LaserJet from 1999 which finally died. The toner cartridges were expensive, but averaged 1 to 2 cents per text page.
customer_reviews.author: Rusty Sly

customer_reviews.title: Nice Printer
customer_reviews.text: This is a great printer and we use it primarily for printing medical prescriptions. It works well for that and these last a long time and the toner is a pretty good yield. There are better printers out there for yield, but for our purpose it is used pretty lightly and the toner does not need changed very often. The printer is very easy to setup and manage via the web interface. Having AirPrint is a nice plus.
customer_reviews.author: ITBob

customer_reviews.title: Money saver
customer_reviews.text: Replaced an HP LaserJet with this. Per-sheet cost down at least 50%. Way more reliable. Will not buy a LaserJet again.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph Mark Gentry

customer_reviews.title: HP Laserjet Pro
customer_reviews.text: So far working well just recieved today. Make sure you remove all the red tape and the 2 red tabs on the included toner cartrige as the instructions are a little veg about this. The software installs automaticly takes less than 10 min. and then a reboot of your PC. The test page came out fast and was flawless, also printed 1 envelope with same results. I wanted a printer that will be there and do it's job when I need it and long times between usage without worrying about the ink drying up. Hopefully this is it !!!!
customer_reviews.author: Eric V.

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work...still no refund!
customer_reviews.text: Not only was the product poorly packaged, it did not work and made a horrible grinding noise when turned on. To make matters worse, I followed ALL return instructions and still have not been issued my refund! Would give zero stars if I could.
customer_reviews.author: L & P Ballasch

customer_reviews.title: Used and abused printer
customer_reviews.text: This is not a new printer. It is rough looking, has scuffs all over. It looks like it's missing a part, too. Seems to work ok, but what the heck
customer_reviews.author: Christel Bastida

customer_reviews.title: Was great until the M201dw came out
customer_reviews.text: I was initially using this printer for our Central Offices, but have since switched to the M201dw. I believe the M201dw is the replacement for this and it is a worthy replacement. The M201dw has better features and a better design. The price has skyrocketed on this model as well. If you are looking for an affordable B/W printer, check out the M201dw.
customer_reviews.author: Brock

customer_reviews.title: HP 1606DN
customer_reviews.text: Just received. Early review: The easiest set up I've ever experienced. We use it with Windows 7 and the set up was fast (20 minutes from opening the box to "go") and without any difficulty. The printer makes no noise at all when not printing. Once you click on print it can't be more than 4 seconds before it prints. Amazing. It's just plain fast. 30 pages get printed (in duplex mode, too) in a couple of minutes. Print quality is very good on HP multi-purpose paper. So far, I'd say this is a real winner.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Berman

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 15 months
customer_reviews.text: The printer worked well for the first 15 months then just stopped working. The connections seem to be cycling on and off. Gave it 2 stars since it ran pretty well during the time it worked. Used in an office with moderate printing. Not sure if it is hardware or software. Second HP laser jet that broke within 2 years that we owned. I am done with HP - they are not the company they were. There printers do not last like they did in their prime.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Herzog

customer_reviews.title: Our Go-To Network Printer
customer_reviews.text: I buy this particular printer frequently for our branch offices for heavy use by a small network of users. The machine is easy to set up, and the brand is reliable. Prints are crisp and clear, and communication between printer and networked client machines is fast. one caveat--be aware that HP installs a status monitor to each client machine that begins on Windows startup. I always disable that feature in startup so all my users don't have to worry about ink levels and such.
customer_reviews.author: Meredith

customer_reviews.title: everything i could hope for from a laserjet
customer_reviews.text: i love this printer. i purchased it to replace an older laserjet model. tnis one is fantastic. i love being able to print from anywhere in the house and never having to turn the printer on or off. my favorite feature so far is the duplexing. i choose this hp over the other laserjets because of the ability to duplex and i am so happy i did. this is a high quality printer that is very fast and dependable.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer1245

customer_reviews.title: Great basic printer for home and office use!
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful and sturdy basic printer that we use in my office as a stand-alone personal printer for various people. It is very reliable and also can print double-sided, print envelopes and labels and tent cards. We have at least 10 of them around our office and they last and last. Unfortunately, Hewlett Packard is not making this model anymore, so I was really glad to find it on amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Feather

customer_reviews.title: Terrific little printer
customer_reviews.text: I'm so glad I bought this printer for our home office. We networked the printer wirelessly so all the kids can print school papers from their respective rooms (and laptops) plus from two desktops in the home. The printer is FAST! Quality of the printing is really good in true HP style. I'm tracking our toner usage but so far, so good. I'd gladly purchase this printer again and we've been using ours for a little over 6 months now. Can't believe the price is down to less than $150 now. What a deal!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Works great, but HP annoyes
customer_reviews.text: We bought this network printer to be used in a public computer club. Setup was easy and the printer works very well. However, HP has a very annoying policy - the "starter" toner cartridge contains VERY LITTLE toner (it lasted 2-weeks). If you purchase this printer (or any HP laser printer), be sure to also purchase toner. NOTE: Amazon sells terrific "re-manufactured" toner cartridges. The cartridges from Black Printing Supply for this printer are TERRIFIC.
customer_reviews.author: Nice Guy

customer_reviews.title: Powerful little workhorse
customer_reviews.text: I run a small print shop and print dozens of invoices and work orders a day. We had been using color laser printers for this purpose, but decided to switch to black and white to save money. I installed it in my office as a back-up and moved it out to the production floor when the color machine went down. We never did buy a big expensive B&W laser printer because this one has been doing just fine. It starts up fast and never jams. It even has a duplexer. I ended up buying another one for my office. The after-market toner cartridges work fine.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen C.

customer_reviews.title: HP P1606dn Printer
customer_reviews.text: I got this printer to replace a 12-year old laser printer by the same manufacturer. I was looking for a printer that was fast, connected to the network, and also provided Airprint service for our Apple devices. The driver installed without a hitch on Windows XP and 7 and the printer worked without a problem with our Apple devices. The only issue I have had is when printing Christmas cards on card stock. On the inside of the card, where I used a bold typeface, the toner would come off in clumps if I feed in the card stock as quick as the printer would take it. If I paused a few seconds between cards, the toner adhered fine.
customer_reviews.author: Erin L. Brandy

customer_reviews.title: Reliable and easy to install
customer_reviews.text: I have many of these scattered around the office. The cost is manageable. With newer PC's all you have to do is plug it in and it should prompt you to install your drivers automatically. We use 3rd party toner cartridges all the time with them and they work like a charm. So this isnt a printer you have to worry about only buying OEM toner cartridges. The quality of printing is good. I would recommend this printer for office usage. We have never had malfuntions.
customer_reviews.author: CPSC Purchasing

customer_reviews.title: Going on three years strong!
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I have been running pages through this printer for 3 years now, and still going strong. The duplexing capability is a very nice feature, and the cost of this printer is extremely reasonable. What we've paid in inkjet refills before would more than pay for this printer, switching to this model was a no-brainer. We've only had to buy one refill- and the sample ink it came with lasted us a long time. Very very happy on this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Solid!
customer_reviews.text: the LaserJet Pro P1606dn was easy to setup and get online and printing via network in less than 20 min, from box to printing. Network discovery was much simpler than old HP4's and their Jetdirect cards, was able to quickly publish via MS Windows active directory also. (2008R2 A/D). Cost was low when considering duplex printing and network access are included. Will have to see how the test of time works out on this one. overall - great printer for less $$ than most, quiet, quick - 4 stars, cause nothing fits everyone's needs. :) R.B.
customer_reviews.author: Rman

customer_reviews.title: Good Purchase
customer_reviews.text: We bought this printer for our office to replace an earlier model HP which got really tired and cranky. It's pretty clear that this category of printer is ultimately going to be disposable, the question is how long you can expect to keep them. This model is smaller, prints much faster, and is a bit quieter. Thus far it appears to be dependable and reliable, and for the price paid, if it makes it 2 or 3 years, I've received my moneys worth. Even if I have to buy two of these it makes more sense for me than a larger, more expensive machine that will last only a bit longer. So far, I'm satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: J. Altschule

customer_reviews.title: works well so far
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this so far. My prior printer (Brother) was a real hassle to use with envelopes. It required both a mechanical setting on the printer and a software setting on the computer. This new HP runs even heavy envelopes without any fuss whatsoever -- I just feed them in and it prints them. I have had other HP printers in the past and found them to be reliable and trouble-free. I've learned my lesson about buying off-brand printers.
customer_reviews.author: MizzouEngr

customer_reviews.title: As Advertised: Very fast, very easy
customer_reviews.text: This is easily the fastest printer I've ever owned. While setup was a bit of a self-inflicted headache (make sure you use a USB 2.0 cable), I was immediately able to print a 175 page PDF as double-sided in roughly 4 minutes. No jams, no issues at all. The user interface on the printer is very minimal, which is a good thing in my opinion. I'm very happy with my purchase and if you're looking for simple, high volume black and white document printing, I don't think you can go wrong with the P1606dn.
customer_reviews.author: Ben S

customer_reviews.title: Did not work ... HP support is a freaking nightmare
customer_reviews.text: Despite attempts with two different toner cartridges, I continue to get a toner warning from this thing. I cannot print anything. I have been on the phone for 35 minutes with someone at a call center in India who has clearly never seen the printer and asked me dozens of irrelevant questions. Now I am on hold for a supervisor. SOOO frustrated. I agree about the lack of a USB cable - if you need a USB cable to install, include it. It can't be that big a cost element.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Here is one HP printer you can love!
customer_reviews.text: Love this printer!! It just works! And it works fast! After those silly HP inkjets always clogging up, losing wifi connections, etc etc, I was getting really down on HP brand printers. This printer is a real joy to use -- the duplexer has never jammed, it prints from standby mode real quickly, and it doesn't use up much space either. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis S

customer_reviews.title: Good basic B&W laser printer
customer_reviews.text: I didn't need anything fancy. I just wanted an inexpensive B&W laser printer so I wouldn't have to use my Photo inkjet printer to print basic b&w business documents. The printer is *very* fast; surprisingly so. I have both PCs and Macs on my home network and this printer was easy to set up with both Windows 7 and Mac OSX. The only downside (as others have mentioned) is that it is a bit noisy, but it doesn't really bother me. In fact I really don't know how noisy it is in relation to other laser printers as there is no way I can make a comparison.
customer_reviews.author: jonboy

customer_reviews.title: Terrific Bargain
customer_reviews.text: I bought this based on a recommendation from David Pogue's New York Times column. Everything he said turned out to be spot-on, including easy, out-of-the-box setup. All of other printers are Epson except for one Brother, a similar device for which a new toner cart and drum were going to cost as much as a brand new printer. This HP replaces it. It's fast and permits printing from my iPhone and iPad.
customer_reviews.author: David C. Scott

customer_reviews.title: This printer is really good!
customer_reviews.text: This LaserJet printer is faster, smarter, better than I would have expected. It was easier to install on my (four-computer) network than I expected; now I can easily print from any computer. You can see the Explorer-based control panel from any computer and do a lot of tweaking, if you want to, including auto-duplex (both sides) printing. I have had a couple of other HP LaserJet printers before, but this is the best. Ask HP about their Care Pack Services, too, for a longer warranty, better support, and a faster exchange if you need it.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Sokolove

customer_reviews.title: Basic but does what I need
customer_reviews.text: Needed a printer for making circuit boards. Complete success, the toner for this printer is A-1. Plus am delighted with the auto-duplexer for making double-sided documents, and it prints on my self-carboning invoice paper with no issues (my inkjets had a hard time feeding the paper, it tends to stick together as it comes out of the tray). I do wish the driver had a "mirror" option. But my PCB software prints correctly without mirroring, so haven't needed it yet.
customer_reviews.author: R. S. Jones

customer_reviews.title: I love this printer and this is my second one
customer_reviews.text: Great little printer. Hard to believe that the original HP price was over $600! It probably has many features I am not using/don't need. The printer is fast, jam-free, and highest quality. This is my second purchase (one in Denver and the other in Tucson.) Both work perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Stewart

customer_reviews.title: hoping that was the case because this printer has been great.
customer_reviews.text: This printer works really well, so far. Although, recently when I tried to print some stuff the printer began to steam and it became really hot. I think it may be because it was too close to the wall (and it was very cold inside)? I'm not sure, but I moved it, hoping that was the case because this printer has been great.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberley

customer_reviews.title: The printer arrived in very good condition & was easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: The printer arrived in very good condition & was easy to set up. I was concerned that the cartridges I had would not fit properly as the number in the listing was not the same as what i had, but they worked just fine. I had a few minor technical issues which were overcome without incident. I'm very satisfied with the printer.
customer_reviews.author: Barry Katz

customer_reviews.title: A lot of scratches and it could work a little better. Next time I'll spend the extra money for ...
customer_reviews.text: Not so "lightly" used. A lot of scratches and it could work a little better. Next time I'll spend the extra money for a brand new one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great printer
customer_reviews.text: Previously I bought Brother HL 2270 DW (for $99 on amazon), but that one was way noisy (unless sleeping) even when it was not printing -- because of the fan. I sent that product back twice and then decided not to waste my time and buy this HP I was not disappointed. It's fast, it's making sounds only when it's printing and it looks fine. I would recommend it to others.
customer_reviews.author: GetReal

customer_reviews.title: this machine will not disappoint. It prints 2-sided when required
customer_reviews.text: As a light-duty BW laser printer, this machine will not disappoint. It prints 2-sided when required, and is much faster than an inkjet. Be aware that this is not a Wi-Fi printer. However, if you leave it plugged into a networked computer, you can gain access to it through your Wi-Fi network, so long as the printer is 'shared' on that machine.
customer_reviews.author: T. Tschirgi

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup, quick printing
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for work. It was for the owner of the company. This showed up on the date it said it would. Setup was as easy as it claims and it's fast with good printing quality. The CEO is happy and he is not the easiest to please. We ended up purchasing another one of these for a remote office from Office Depot. I've only heard good things from there as well. The printers have only been in use for 2 months so I can't attest for the longevity of the product, but I would definitely buy again if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: HP By far the Best Printer
customer_reviews.text: Guys I love my printer. Works like a charm and price is just right for the quality. If you want Quality Printer + Quality Drivers that work count on HP. HP also offers GREAT LINUX SUPPORT. From now on I will only buy HP products when it comes to printers and scanners because all my experiences with HP have been great compared to other leading brands.
customer_reviews.author: J.D.

customer_reviews.title: LaserJet Printer
customer_reviews.text: Arrived two days earlier than promised(great). Easy setup. Works great. We use this at home. I have had ink jet printers. They go thru cartridges without using the unit. We had a older LaserJet unit till it finally quit working properly. We had to buy a special cable USB to a Centronics to get it to work( it was over 15 years old). Time for a new one!
customer_reviews.author: Blue

customer_reviews.title: Good buy,
customer_reviews.text: The printer is excellent, and virtually installed itself within 10 to 5 minutes of being switched on for the first time. Very fast, can do double sided copies. The price is very good and I doubt can be beaten, and as I have Amazon Prime no shipping costs (and it arrived within 24 hours even though I did not pay extra for overnight shipping). I've used an HP LaserJet since 2001, and this was the replacement. Really happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Duane Balay

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Got this printer for my etsy business about four months ago to replace a crap canon inkjet. We print about 400 labels a month on special laser paper and so far it's really performed well. My only complaint is sometimes it cuts off part of the label, but I think this was brought on by me using a different, non-laser label. Make sure you get the good labels!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Catapano

customer_reviews.title: Workhorse without big expense
customer_reviews.text: Cartridges don't cost an arm and a leg & last. The printer setup was fall-off-a-log easy. It has handled a lot of print duty without a hiccup. The instructions on the buttons on top of this simple machine are maybe too spartan, but once I got used to the device, no problem. It's B&W only of course - a workhorse.
customer_reviews.author: M. Flynn

customer_reviews.title: Very good price and product
customer_reviews.text: Very good price and product, had one that died on me and just can't let go of the model !!
customer_reviews.author: Donna J. Slobodny

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: This was by far the easiest printer to install on our LAN. We were able to see it from any computer on the network within minutes without the help of a network engineer. It does require admin rights to install locally, and is somewhat noisy - but it also has a "quiet" mode that we have not yet tried. Its normal mode is much faster that any of our other printers - I assume the quiet mode will be somewhat slower.
customer_reviews.author: GW

customer_reviews.title: A real workhorse!
customer_reviews.text: I just replaced my 8-year-old HP 1200 LaserJet with this model. It is faster than the old one and handles envelopes better. Installation is quite easy, if you follow the illustrated step-by-step instructions. I just hope it is as durable as the old HP LaserJet. For print quality, it can't be beat!
customer_reviews.author: Bob W.

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price!
customer_reviews.text: A laserjet printer duplex printer for $130 +/-? That's a excellent bargain. I was able to unpack it, plug it into my router, and started using it from my iMac in 30 minutes or less. Duplex printing is fast. I will update my review after 2-3 months of use, but my first impression is 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Chris F

customer_reviews.title: If trying to print wireless, it is a real pain
customer_reviews.text: Previously had an hp printer attached to my network via apple airport express. Had no problems with old printer. This printer has some auto off feature that results in not being able to print unless I unplug and replug both the airport express and the printer. A real annoyance that basically makes it a real pain every time I want to print beyond the auto off period (4 hours I think) I am no computer ignoramus, but have not found a solution.
customer_reviews.author: Nomas

customer_reviews.title: I use this LaserJet for my home office
customer_reviews.text: My HP4 finally gave up after many, many years. I was looking for a LaserJet printer that would do a professional looking job and also print my Quicken checks. Most important it printed a full page, two checks and a single check. This printer does everything my HP4 did faster and better. It takes up much less room and is quitter.
customer_reviews.author: Nervous about germs!!

customer_reviews.title: Great printer
customer_reviews.text: I don't write many reviews...only for stuff I really love or hate, and I love this printer. It is fast, reliable, and prints great looking documents. Importantly it works perfectly with AirPrint, and our iPads, and iPhone work great with the printer. Yes, the toner could be cheaper, but for low volume home and small office use this would be a excellent choice.
customer_reviews.author: Intrepid

customer_reviews.title: Excellent printer
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this for about two years now and it still works great. I would have liked a larger paper stack so that a whole ream of paper would fit. but that's a minor issue and has nothing to do with performance. Duplex printing is great and has saved me money on paper.
customer_reviews.author: Ellary Kahan

customer_reviews.title: Good office printer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my dad and it works well for his home. I have the same printer in my busy office. Love it, the only con I have is - this printer only likes to print 3 checks on one page at at time. The printer jams the checks if you try to run/print only 1 or 2 checks (using QB for check printing). But all around happy with the speed of the printer and quality of the printing.
customer_reviews.author: Lauretta Harsha

customer_reviews.title: Great Duplex Printer, but Very Loud
customer_reviews.text: I have owned 3 HP Laser Printers over the years and could not resist the price of this HP LaserJet for its many features - duplex, econo-mode, energy star, speed. While it does a great job, it is loud, the loudest I have ever heard for a laser printer. Don't print while talking on the phone, as the person on the other end may think there is a plane taking off in your office. :)
customer_reviews.author: Fred

customer_reviews.title: Thia printer Replaced an HP 1006 to provide LAN compatibiliity ...
customer_reviews.text: Thia printer Replaced an HP 1006 to provide LAN compatibiliity, which it did, after a lot of nail-biting. Cranky setup period, improved with use. I did not trust Wireless in an older house nailed together 30 years ago. Printer Goes Ape if you qllow it to run out of pqper. . A LOVE/HATE RELATIONSHIP WILL FOLLOW.
customer_reviews.author: Screwball1936

customer_reviews.title: HP LASERJET P1606DN
customer_reviews.text: WHEN PURCHASED, I WAS SEEKING A LASER JET PRINTER WITH DUPLEX PRINTING CAPABILITY TO REPLACE A HP LASER AND DUPLEX PRINTER WHICH HAD PERFORMED WELL OVER TEN YEARS. THIS MODEL IS A GREAT LASER PRINTER. SETUP TOOK 20-30 MINUTES; SETUP INSTRUCTIONS WERE CLEAR BUT UNNECESSARY. I HAVE BEEN USING THIS PRINTER FOR FOUR MONTHS AND IT HAS PERFORMED BEAUTIFULLY. I RECOMMEND VERY STRONGLY.
customer_reviews.author: Henry C. Cernansky

customer_reviews.title: it was a smart purchase, a great price—$147
customer_reviews.text: I will never purchase another printer from any other manufacturer. I purchased this printer in January 2014 with an additional cartridge; the original cartridge had a yield of 1,000 but I only got 960 impressions. The second cartridge had a potential yield of 2,160, but I noticed a little streaking after 2,460 total pages. Much of the work I create is duplexed, printed on two sides. Today I purchased two additional cartridges from Amazon for just under $118 with shipping. This little printer is a workhorse, it was a smart purchase, a great price—$147.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: fair
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for the HP name, meaning great engineering and reliability, and so forth. The set-up was amazingly easy. But, one of the features most important to me, duplex printing (prints on both sides of the paper), didn't work after a few days. Every time I try it, the paper jams in the machine.
customer_reviews.author: Muse

customer_reviews.title: Excellent printer.
customer_reviews.text: Durable. A real money-saver. The toner cartridges are very cost-effective. I've had mine since 2012 (5 years), and it's still working like new.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Good basic printer
customer_reviews.text: It prints well. Double sided prints get a little off center on side 2. The power save software tends to give me problems with my print spooler. I have to start the printer & wait for my computer to recognize the printer before I initiate the print command.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn A. Ward

customer_reviews.title: Printer is great, instructions are pitifully poor.
customer_reviews.text: Works meet my expectations. Excellent printer for the price. As with most installation instructions these days, well ............. they are pitiful (at best). Thankfully, I have some knowledge I could rely on. Heaven help those who have never set up and installed a printer before.
customer_reviews.author: Inglenook

customer_reviews.title: Worked well
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my HP ink jet. I kept the ink jet, but that ink was killing me. This worked well and I can't complain about the speed or quality. I comes right on with no problems and prints quickly and quietly. I most use it to print the kids homework etc....
customer_reviews.author: Kevin P. Laman

customer_reviews.title: Looks good...
customer_reviews.text: We had this one drop shipped to one of our other facilities. I'm assuming it made it there okay and since we haven't gotten any calls about it, I guess it works. In hindsight, I should probably follow up more often on this type of stuff...
customer_reviews.author: Gus Malley

customer_reviews.title: I love everything about this printer except it must be connected ...
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about this printer except it must be connected to my router. Can't use WiFi to connect. Once plugged into back of router you can WiFi to your IPhones and IPads etc.. Works like a champ! Super fast and never jams.
customer_reviews.author: Terry W

customer_reviews.title: Better than Wireless!
customer_reviews.text: This printer has it's own I.P. Address which makes it extremely easy to install. Prints 100 pages in less than 3 minutes I love this printer best printer I have ever owned. And the printer cartridges aren't even that expensive. Very happy and satisfied with this printer. Worth well over 150 dollars that I paid. Here is a link to the cartridges the least expensive I have found for this printer:
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Great printer
customer_reviews.text: I am a full time student doing online classes I print a lot. I will be starting class next week and it will be put to the test then. So far it works great no problems. I bought a laser printer because I print so much I would go through 6 black ink cartridges and at least 3 color in a semester. I will add an update later after I have used it with school some.
customer_reviews.author: K. Danford

customer_reviews.title: It is a very good B/W laser printer
customer_reviews.text: It is a very good B/W laser printer. The cartridge lasts full one year. There is a "EconoMode" setting that increases the life of the cartridge. The speed is very good. The network option allows to print remotely from a smart phone. The price is very reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: Naveen K. Mital

customer_reviews.title: Good Printer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer because I needed a simple printer, and one that the inks would not dry up on. Being toner this should not happen. So far this printer has done everything I have asked it to do. It was an easy install, and has great quality printing.
customer_reviews.author: W. Todd Stoneking

customer_reviews.title: one-sided printing
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful printer. Smooth, quiet, excellent printing and fast. Now two-sided printing proved to be a challenge as back side of page printed upside down, or in tablet form. After speaking to me new friend Faraj from New Delhi at HP I learned that this printer was not capable of printing in booklet form, where you could simply turn the page over from right to left to read the back side. Something was said about this being a feature of laser printers, but I did not catch that. This was also news to Faraj as he attempted a number of driver fixes and downloads. This is my first laser printer, but I remain puzzled by this answer from HP.
customer_reviews.author: David W. Worthington

customer_reviews.title: Great for Writers
customer_reviews.text: Perfect if you want fast, no-frills black and white printing! I'm a writer and this was essential to get my manuscripts printed without having to wait forever- which can happen with a 200 page book. I also love the fact that it has a high capacity ink cartridge- also good for large projects. Great printer!
customer_reviews.author: Beth B

customer_reviews.title: Just works
customer_reviews.text: While I cannot speak to it's longevity, thus far I am pleased with the speed and quality of print. Works well with ePrint and air print for my iPhone and iPad devices. Easy setup, using with Ethernet connection with Linux and Windows 7 devices.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Great little printer
customer_reviews.text: David Pogue raved about it ... so I bought it ... install was the easiest printer install ever ... output is dark and sharp ... and it turns itself off (when I forget). Not too pretty to look at with the innards on display, but it just prints!!!
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Good solid, duplex, networked laser printer
customer_reviews.text: After many years, my HP LaserJet 5P finally died. Got this printer as replacement. Works great. Small footprint, great duplex, fast printing, clear print, easy network access. Only down side so far, it's a bit loud on print cycle / paper handling ... but then automatically goes to sleep ... so not much of a downside. Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: This printer is working great for us
customer_reviews.text: This printer is working great for us, we use it a lot. I love the large paper storage and large ink cartridges better value than the little ink cartridges.
customer_reviews.author: Cece

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Printer
customer_reviews.text: This printer is awesome! It spews out the pages really quickly, it spools up quickly, it's easy to network and I can easily print to it from my ipad. I think they're great printers for both a small office and a normal household.
customer_reviews.author: Adam W.

customer_reviews.title: Good Printer
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased around a dozen of these personal printers for my company and they have all performed as advertised. No issues with any of them and some have been in service for an extended period.
customer_reviews.author: BT

customer_reviews.title: Great printer. If your looking for something that is ...
customer_reviews.text: Great printer. If your looking for something that is networked and can print many pages in black & white before having to replace toner. Then this is the printer for you.
customer_reviews.author: E the Consumer

customer_reviews.title: A great HP basic printer for home or office
customer_reviews.text: I purchased several of these HP printers for my work. They are sturdy and run for years without needing repair. Unfortunately, I think HP has now discontinued them.
customer_reviews.author: Feather

customer_reviews.title: could never get it to work.... ...
customer_reviews.text: could never get it to work....and could not return it....never came with any instructions or a disk.....nothing but the printer.
customer_reviews.author: bettylandon

customer_reviews.title: A great workhorse printer
customer_reviews.text: A great workhorse printer. I only buy one every few years so anyway, didn't want an all-in-one and this one has proven reliable already for 3+ years of light use.
customer_reviews.author: JoeCustomer1776

customer_reviews.title: Quick, quiet, reliable
customer_reviews.text: Great little printer. Quick to print first page. I use this and three others at work for financial/HR people. Quick, quiet, reliable
customer_reviews.author: vttimwhite

customer_reviews.title: Great copier!
customer_reviews.text: I am really enjoying my new copier. I love that it prints on both sides automatically. Great way to save paper. It is fast and efficient. Came supper fast and it was at a very good price.
customer_reviews.author: C. Bryant

customer_reviews.title: This is a great printer. Not only is the quality outstanding
customer_reviews.text: This is a great printer. Not only is the quality outstanding, but it has built-in 2-sided printing and network capability. Best of all . . . it's FAST! Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Larry H.

customer_reviews.title: Simple printer!  Just what we wanted.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this printer for my Dad. It is perfect for him. Simple. Easy to operate. Easy to set up. We may purchase one for us, too. We are very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Mostly

customer_reviews.title: Just Delivered
customer_reviews.text: Arrived today, and contrary to another review, it did contain a toner cart. Install was easy. You have to set the preference for two-sided printing. Amazingly fast, from clicking print to having the print seems to take no time. Relatively quiet when printing, and totally quiet otherwise. Print seems clean and sharp on 1200. Will do a little more experimenting, and then update this review in a month. A little bigger than my old samsung, but not obnoxiously so. Its not as heavy either.
customer_reviews.author: S. Lease

customer_reviews.title: Great Economy Type Printer
customer_reviews.text: These are great lower volume printers and they really hold up well. This printer was about $35 less than the locals (Staples0Best Buy). Will purchase again as the need arises for sure! A+++ printer
customer_reviews.author: Firechief24

customer_reviews.title: Where are the USB cords and sample toner?
customer_reviews.text: I have heard everyone mention a sample toner that comes with the printer. This printer didn't even include that, let alone the USB cord. Talk about your basic model. I haven't used it yet so will update with performance later.
customer_reviews.author: Matt T

customer_reviews.title: Prints Like a Dream
customer_reviews.text: I should have done this years ago. That's because 95% of my printing is simply b/w. And this printer does b/w like no ink jet I've ever had. Simple to set up. Fast as lightning. It's a dream machine.
customer_reviews.author: Joe R

customer_reviews.title: Good machine.
customer_reviews.text: The machine is up and running very fast for its price. The toner catridge HP 78A is a little bit too expensive. So I give it a four stars. I would recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Seth

customer_reviews.title: Not too shabby!
customer_reviews.text: First of all, I must have read the advertising blurb incorrectly, because I was under the impression that this was a wireless network printer. The fact that I'd been to a local retail store to look at various printers didn't help. In any event, I was able to work this with my (Antidiluvian) Linksys print server (forget the print server software, install as a local USB printer, then set up a fixed IP address in the server and print to that TCP/IP address in Windows, and you're done!(yes, I KNOW it sounds easy, but it's a pain in the A**!)). The printer itself is fast and smooth, and for the price it can't be beat!!
customer_reviews.author: ccmboy

customer_reviews.title: Very good but not great; excellent value
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Here's what prevents me from giving it 5 stars- it's a bit noisy and the duplex printing prints the back side upside down However, it's clearly a very good value
customer_reviews.author: Nat

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great buy! Didn't come with any cords though, and was a bit scratched up. functioned just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Excellent low cost printer
customer_reviews.text: I now have 2 of these printers. They are excellent for low volume use (a few page a day). The duplex feature is very handy. The small size is also a plus. No problems with the 1st one I bought (had it over 6 months now).
customer_reviews.author: JwwJws

product_meta.title: HP Laserjet Pro P1606dn Printer - Old Version, (CE749A)
feature_bullets: Fast laser printing for small offices. Share the printer among a small office, using built-in Ethernet networking.
Print at up to 26 ppm letter/25 ppm A4, plus start printing fast with Instant-on Technology.
Print on a wide variety of media, using the 250-sheet paper tray and 10-sheet priority input slot.
Save threefold: paper, energy and money. Save paper with automatic two-sided printing. Conserve energy with Instant-on Technology and save even more with HP Auto-On/Auto-Off Technology.
Print from virtually anywhere with HP ePrint. Now with AirPrint. Simply print wirelessly from your iPad, iPhone, and iPod touch.
Professional, cost-effective laser printing. Produce professional-quality business prints with bold, crisp text and sharp images. Receive improved print quality with HP FastRes 1200.
Save space and reduce printer sound with an ultra-compact, space-saving printer with a "quiet" mode.
One-year limited hardware warranty; 24-hour, 7 days a week Web support
